thothbot.parallax.core.shared.core

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • thothbot.parallax.core.shared.core.Color

  • public final class Color
extends java.lang.Object
    The Color class is used encapsulate colors in the default RGB color space. This class doesn't work with alpha value. Each RGB value stored as values in range [0.0-1.0]. Where value of 1.0 is 255 means that the color is completely shown and an color value of 0 or 0.0 means that the color is completely hidden.
    Author:
    thothbot

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Color()
      This default constructor will create color where R=1.0, G=1.0, B=1.0 ie (255, 255, 255) or 0xFFFFFF in HEX.
      Color(int hex)
      This constructor will create Color instance by defined HEX value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Color

        public Color()
        This default constructor will create color where R=1.0, G=1.0, B=1.0 ie (255, 255, 255) or 0xFFFFFF in HEX.

      • Color

        public Color(int hex)
        This constructor will create Color instance by defined HEX value. For example 0xFFFFFF will create a color in RGB(255, 255, 255), which means completely white.
        Parameters:
        hex - Color in HEX format

        public int getHex()
        get color in HEX. For example 0xFFFFFF, which means completely white.

      • setHex

        public void setHex(int hex)
        Setting color in HEX format. For example 0xFFFFFF will create a color in RGB(255, 255, 255), which means completely white.
        Parameters:
        hex - Color in HEX format

      • setRGB

        public Color setRGB(double r,
           double g,
           double b)
        Setting color in RGB mode. Each of R, G, B should be in range <0.0, 1.0>.
        Parameters:
        r - the R-component of Color.
        g - the G-component of Color.
        b - the B-component of Color.
        Returns:
        a current color

      • setHSV

        public Color setHSV(double h,
           double s,
           double v)
        Setting color based on HSV color model. Each input values H, S, V should be in range <0.0, 1.0>. This method based on MochiKit implementation by Bob Ippolito
        Parameters:
        h - the hue
        s - the saturation
        v - the value
        Returns:
        a current color

      • lerp

        public void lerp(Color color,
        double alpha)
        Linearly interpolates between the current color and input color.
        Parameters:
        color - the input color
        alpha - the alpha value in range <0.0, 1.0>

      • clone

        public Color clone()
        Clone the current color class. (color.clone() != color).
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a new color instance, based on the current color class

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        get Color class description by multiplying each value by 255. Please not this is not real used values. This is just for readability.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
